subject: Gardening
title: The Kitchen Gardens of Provence
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Kitchen Gardens of Provence.

hook.text: French potagers aren't just vegetable patches. They're designed gardens where food growing is treated as visual art.

buildup.text: A potager arranges vegetables, herbs, and flowers in geometric beds. Beauty and productivity share equal importance.

climax.text: The French potager proves that food production and beauty aren't opposites. Designing for both achieves more of each.

punchline.text: Make your vegetable garden beautiful and you'll grow more food.

quiz.question: What is unique about the French potager approach to food gardening?
options: It uses only heirloom French varieties forbidden in other countries
It treats food growing as visual art, balancing beauty with productivity
It relies on companion planting as the sole pest management method
